snippet: Conservation groups say poachers are wiping out tens of thousands of elephants a year, more than at any time in the previous two decades, with the ivory trade becoming increasingly militarized.
abstract: Conservation groups say African poachers are wiping out tens of thousands of elephants a year, more than at any time in the previous two decades, as the underground ivory trade becomes increasingly militarized; some of Africa's most notorious armed groups are hunting down elephants and using tusks to buy weapons and sustain their mayhem, but even African armies have been implicated in poaching. (Series: The Price Of Ivory)

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush contributed reporting from Omdurman, Sudan; Mia Li from Beijing; and a Somali journalist from Mogadishu, Somalia.

lead_paragraph: Conservation groups say poachers are wiping out tens of thousands of elephants a year, more than at any time in the previous two decades, with the ivory trade becoming increasingly militarized.

headline.seo: Africa’s Elephants Are Being Slaughtered in Poaching Frenzy
headline.main: Elephants Dying in Epic Frenzy as Ivory Fuels Wars and Profits
headline.print_headline: Elephants Dying in Epic Frenzy As Ivory Fuels Wars and Profits
